definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Ding Hong great learning, who has researched the book right through.
sentences.chinese: 丁鸿很有学问，对经书极有研究。

sentences.english: When he was but twelve years old he was already studying Tendai philosophical speculation.
sentences.chinese: 他十二岁时已经开始研习天台宗经书。

sentences.english: Xuanzang built the pagoda in order to have a place for his Buddhist books.
sentences.chinese: 玄奘修建大雁塔是为了存放经书。

sentences.english: Making time for reading religious and sacred texts is a challenge in our own time.
sentences.chinese: 而我们的时代，腾出时间阅读宗教经书却是件难事。

sentences.english: The book closes with the Israelites residing in Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 经书结束时以色列人定居埃及。

sentences.english: Unless they are proper books written by sages, we should avoid reading them.
sentences.chinese: 若非圣贤所传述的正经书，一定摒弃不看。

sentences.english: The leaves of the sutra Merely stir a sad wind.
sentences.chinese: 只剩页页经书扰起一股悲风。

sentences.english: They simply weren't considered to be of the same status as the 24 books.
sentences.chinese: 但这些作品和那24卷经书无法具有同等地位。

definition: volumes of classics/volumes of scriptures/ancient scrolls

The Sutra in Forty-two Sections Spoken by the Buddha, the first Chinese Buddhist text, translated in 67 by Kasyapa-Matanga 迦葉摩騰 and Gobharana 竺法蘭 (Dharmaraksha)
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
manuscript copy of a book (before the printing press)
sutra written on leaves of pattra palm tree
